results.title: Taking action
results.creator_credit: TV Ed Productions and James Mann
results.brief_description: This video has been prepared to assist and challenge people in positions of responsibility in schools to provide active and supportive leadership to staff by identifying issues of concern; creating openings for discussion; and taking action in creative, caring and supportive ways. Presents three case studies showing typical school situations in which work performance and organisational issues affect staff relations.

results.title: Taking a time study
results.creator_credit: Gerald Cookson, Kinocraft and Stephen Clarkson
results.brief_description: Illustrates the basic techniques for taking a time study. The method illustrated has been agreed upon by the representatives of management and trade unions and is recommended as sound basic training for trainee work study officers. Valuable for showing to people whose work is likely to be the subject of work measurement.

results.title: Taking a chance on love
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling, Susan Dirgham and ACMI
results.brief_description: Many years ago, Susan Dirgham’s parents took a chance on love, in spite of their differences. Her parent’s leap of faith has inspired Susan Dirgham to throw herself into new experiences and follow her heart, which has taken her to some very unusual places. Created as part of an ACMI Digital Storytelling Program in the Digital Studio or outreach program.

results.title: Takeover (A)
results.creator_credit: Judith MacDougall, David MacDougall and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies
results.brief_description: On 13th March, 1978 the Queensland government announced its intention to take over the management of the Aurukun Aboriginal Reserve from the Uniting Church. The people of Aurukun complained bitterly, believing that the Church was more sympathetic to their aims and fearing that the State was merely seeking easier access to the rich bauxite deposits on their Reserve. When the Federal Government took the side of the Aborigines the stage was set for national confrontation. Shows the situation at Aurukun during those crucial three weeks.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Judith MacDougall, David MacDougall and Australian Institute of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Studies

When the Federal Government took the side of the Aborigines the stage was set for national confrontation. Shows the situation at Aurukun during those crucial three weeks.

results.title: Taken by storm
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Cockram, Stella Productions, Telefeatures, South Australian Film Corporation and Mario Andreacchio
results.brief_description: A dramatised film designed to promote an understanding and acceptance of an increasing program of replenishing Adelaide’s beaches. It would be useful in other cities which suffer similar problems. Local councils, secondary students, beachfront dwellers and anyone who enjoys the beach will find this film informative

results.title: Taken
results.creator_credit: Libby Porter, Cinemedia, XY2, Elisabeth Anne Green and Hayley Cloake
results.brief_description: When Sophie finds a message on her answering machine from recently separated husband, Michael, she strikes an unlikely alliance with his ‘errand boy’, Jason. Cast includes Kerry Armstrong, Samuel Johnston and David Michod.

results.title: Take your choice
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: Presented by Heinz, this documentary suggests that boredom and juvenile delinquency can be alleviated by introducing young adults to the organised activities of the Boy Scouts and Girl Guides Associations. Shows a range of activities available including camping, orienteering, water sports and rock climbing. Also shows the various volunteer programs that these associations support.

results.title: Take three (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The work of three secondary teachers and their drama classes is observed to provide the basis for discussion of the approaches to drama shown, and the methods of evaluation in the subject. Shows students in the 11-12 years age group, 15-16 years age group, and fourth year students in an optional drama course.
